titleStmt.title: A briefe declaration of all the civill vvarres that have happened in England; first, in the raigne of King John. Secondly, in the Barrons Warrs. Thirdly, in Yorke and Lancaster Warrs. Fourthly, in the raigne of Henry the eight. Fiftly, in the raigne of King Edward the sixth. Sixthly, in the raigne of Queene Mary. Seventhly, in the raigne of Queene Elizabeth. Eightly, in the raigne of King James. Ninthly, in the raigne of King Charles. Also declaring the civill warre that happened in other nations.

notesStmt.note: A Puritan argument that religious unity is a prerequisite for peace.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
